title: Glances on the wing at foreign lands,
author: Hoyt, James M.
snippet: To the right, stretch into the battle-field  the ridges of Gillies Hill, behind which lay the haggage of Bruce's army and his camp followers.

title: Glances on the wing at foreign lands,
author: Hoyt, James M.

title: Notes of foreign travel.
author: Bates, James Hale
snippet: A mile away is an eminence called " Gillies Hill," behind which Bruce had stationed his camp-followers, who, showing themselves at a critical moment, threw the English into a panic, and gave the Scotch the victory.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
